intro: Tristemma leucanthum, commonly known as the white-flowered tristemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tristemma leucanthum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
